articles.headline: Big Rescue of Funds by Citigroup
articles.snippet: Citigroup moved on Thursday to rescue seven affiliated investment funds that have been upended by the running crisis in housing-related debt.
articles.abstract: Citigroup moved on Thursday to rescue seven affiliated investment funds that have been upended by the running crisis in housing-related debt.
articles.lead_paragraph: Citigroup moved on Thursday to rescue seven affiliated investment funds that have been upended by the running crisis in housing-related debt.

articles.headline: A Worrisome New Wrinkle in Bailouts
articles.snippet: Government cash these days is all the rage on Wall Street, where investment banks long to profit from what they call “sovereign wealth funds.”
articles.abstract: Government cash these days is all the rage on Wall Street, where investment banks long to profit from what they call “sovereign wealth funds.”
articles.lead_paragraph: The financial market crisis of 2007 may be remembered as the beginning of the nationalization of a large part of the financial system. This week, it took a government bailout to shore up UBS. Last month, it was Citigroup that got government aid to help recover from its bad investments.

articles.headline: British Inquiry of Failed Plots Points to Iraq’s Qaeda Group
articles.snippet: The bungled attacks in London and Glasgow six months ago would be the first attacks that the group has been involved in outside of the Middle East.
articles.abstract: The bungled attacks in London and Glasgow six months ago would be the first attacks that the group has been involved in outside of the Middle East.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article is by Raymond Bonner, Jane Perlez and Eric Schmitt.
articles.byline: By Raymond Bonner, Jane Perlez and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Biden Campaigning With Ease After Hardships
articles.snippet: Past personal and political catastrophe has become part of the narrative of Senator Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s campaign.
articles.abstract: Past personal and political catastrophe has become part of the narrative of Senator Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: IOWA CITY  Senator Joseph R. Biden Jr. of Delaware, a back-in-the-pack Democratic candidate for president, was answering a voter’s question last week about negative campaigning when he abruptly began talking about his first, euphoric run for the Senate, in 1972, and the personal tragedy that nearly destroyed his life afterward.

articles.headline: Economy Holding Up, Reports Find
articles.snippet: Government reports released Thursday showed surprising resilience in the broader economy, even as the financial system and the housing market continue to weaken.
articles.abstract: Government reports released Thursday showed surprising resilience in the broader economy, even as the financial system and the housing market continue to weaken.
articles.lead_paragraph: Maybe the American economy is not going to keel over just yet, after all.

articles.headline: A Year Later, the Same Scene: Long Lines for the Elusive Wii
articles.snippet: Nintendo has been unable to keep up with demand for the Wii, its intensely popular video game machine, costing the company hundreds of millions of dollars in potential sales.
articles.abstract: Nintendo has been unable to keep up with demand for the Wii, its intensely popular video game machine, costing the company hundreds of millions of dollars in potential sales.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Linda Beattie is trying desperately to pay Nintendo $250, but the company is not cooperating.

articles.headline: A New Breed of Billionaire
articles.snippet: The global wealth boom has created a new breed of billionaire in once-destitute countries, and a number of them are using their wealth to push for social changes.
articles.abstract: The global wealth boom has created a new breed of billionaire in once-destitute countries, and a number of them are using their wealth to push for social changes.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL  Stuck in a traffic jam in his bulletproof BMW, the richest man in Turkey lets loose with a satisfied grin.
